preprocessed_text: use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the four screw .
remove the rubber gasket from the rain tray .
lift the tray upwards and away from the vehicle .
tagged_relations: lift/HAS_PATIENT/tray,

preprocessed_text: use a flathead screwdriver to remove the cap from the windshield wiper .
use a socket wrench to release the passenger-side windshield wiper locking nut .
gently lift up the passenger-side windshield wiper .
tagged_relations: lift/HAS_AGENT/windshield wiper,

preprocessed_text: remove the driver-side windshield wiper in the same fashion .
lift up the plastic cover .
tagged_relations: lift/HAS_PATIENT/plastic cover,

preprocessed_text: use an offset phillips screwdriver to remove a screw in the back of the automatic control unit cover .
in a pinch , you can make this tool with a phillips driver bit and end wrench .
use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the front two screw .
gently unplug and lift out the automatic transmission control unit .
remove the plastic phillips screw towards the front of the door panel .
this screw is part of a two-piece securing mechanism . do not apply force directly onto the screw head , because it will continue to slip into the plastic clip .
use a flathead screwdriver to remove the plastic clip that hold the screw .
unscrew the phillips screw in the bottom of the door panel cup .
tagged_relations: unscrew/HAS_PATIENT/phillips screw,

preprocessed_text: lift the cup out of the the door panel .
tagged_relations: lift/HAS_PATIENT/cup, lift/HAS_AGENT/door panel,

preprocessed_text: insert a very thin flathead screwdriver blade into the small gap towards the rear of the car on the plastic screw cover near the door handle .
unscrew the phillips screw underneath the screw cover .
remove the plastic cover at the base of the c-pillar by pulling it directly away from the window .
the cover is held in place by a metal clip , so some force will be required to free it .
tagged_relations: free/HAS_AGENT/force, free/HAS_PATIENT/cover, cover/HAS_AGENT/metal clip,

preprocessed_text: in addition to the metal clip , two small tab at the bottom of the cover keep it in place . gently lift the corner of the door panel to remove the tab from their respective hole in the door .
tagged_relations: remove/HAS_PATIENT/tab, remove/HAS_AGENT/gently lift,

preprocessed_text: using firm pressure , pull the door panel away from the door . start at the top right , and work down the side , across the bottom , and up the opposite side .
multiple clip hold the door panel in place . the door panel will jerk a each clip is freed from it position .
tagged_relations: hold/HAS_PATIENT/door panel, hold/HAS_AGENT/multiple clip, clip/HAS_PATIENT/door panel,

preprocessed_text: pull the bottom of the door panel away from the door , and lift the entire panel off the door .
do not try to completely remove the door panel yet , a it is still attached by a number of electrical connector .
push down on the small tab and pull the connector directly away from it socket to disconnect the power lock switch .
tagged_relations: push down/HAS_AGENT/small tab, pull/HAS_AGENT/connector, disconnect/HAS_PATIENT/power lock switch,

preprocessed_text: use the same method described above to remove the connector for the tweeter .
press the tab on the bottom of the larger green connector to disconnect the side-view mirror control .
tagged_relations: press/HAS_AGENT/tab, press/HAS_PATIENT/larger green connector, disconnect/HAS_AGENT/tab, disconnect/HAS_PATIENT/side-view mirror control,

preprocessed_text: disconnect the power window connector .
you may now remove the entire door panel .
use compressed air to clear any debris from the area around the ignition coil on top of the engine .
remove the ignition coil electrical connector by first depressing the plastic tab on top of the connector .
pull the connector straight away from the ignition coil to detach it .
repeat this procedure for the remaining three ignition coil .
tagged_relations: repeat this procedure/HAS_PATIENT/ignition coil, repeat this procedure/HAS_PATIENT/ignition coil, repeat this procedure/HAS_PATIENT/ignition coil,

preprocessed_text: use an 8 mm deep socket to loosen the four ignition coil mounting bolt .
once the bolt are loose , they can be removed by hand .
twist the ignition coil and spark plug boot while lifting it straight up to remove it from the engine .
tagged_relations: twist/HAS_AGENT/ignition coil, twist/HAS_AGENT/spark plug boot, lifting/HAS_PATIENT/ignition coil, lifting/HAS_PATIENT/spark plug boot, remove/HAS_PATIENT/engine,

preprocessed_text: avoid rocking the coil and boot side-to-side , since this could break the existing spark plug .
tagged_relations: avoid rocking/HAS_PATIENT/coil, avoid rocking/HAS_PATIENT/boot, avoid rocking/HAS_AGENT/existing spark plug,

preprocessed_text: use a ratcheting socket wrench with an extender and a 5  or 8 spark plug socket to remove the existing spark plug from the cylinder head . make sure that the spark plug is completely seated in the rubber end of the socket before loosening it .
apply dielectric grease to the ribbed portion of the insulator .
gently place the spark plug boot over the rib and twist the two piece back and forth to even out the layer of dielectric grease .
place the new spark plug firmly in the spark plug socket so that the threaded end stick out .
tagged_relations: place/HAS_PATIENT/new spark plug, place/HAS_AGENT/spark plug socket,

preprocessed_text: apply an even layer of anti-seize compound to the thread of the spark plug .
place the new spark plug into the cylinder head and tighten it by hand a much a you can .
tighten the spark plug to 11 ft-lbs with a torque wrench .
place the ignition coil and dust boot back over the spark plug by pushing down and twisting it into place .
tagged_relations: place/HAS_PATIENT/ignition coil, place/HAS_PATIENT/dust boot, pushing down/HAS_AGENT/ignition coil, twisting/HAS_AGENT/ignition coil,

preprocessed_text: reconnect the ignition coil electrical connector by snapping it back into place .
tagged_relations: reconnect/HAS_PATIENT/ignition coil, reconnect/HAS_AGENT/electrical connector, snapping it back into place/HAS_AGENT/electrical connector,

preprocessed_text: pull the hood release latch at the front right of the tractor and lift the hood up .
lift the hood prop bar from it seat and place it in the hook on the underside of the hood .
pull each tab straight away from the panel and twist them 90 so that they fit through the slot in the panel .
tagged_relations: pull/HAS_AGENT/each tab, twist/HAS_AGENT/each tab,

preprocessed_text: pull the top of the engine panel straight out until it is free from the tab .
lift the engine panel up to remove it and set it aside .
tagged_relations: lift/HAS_AGENT/engine panel, remove/HAS_PATIENT/engine panel,

preprocessed_text: the drain plug is a 17 mm hex bolt located on the underside of the tractor .
tagged_relations: drain plug/HAS_PATIENT/17 mm hex bolt,

preprocessed_text: place an oil drain pan underneath the drain plug to catch the oil when it begin to drain .
use a 17 mm box end wrench to loosen the drain plug 3  or 4 of a turn .
loosen the drain plug by hand until it come out and oil begin to drain from the oil pan .
tagged_relations: loosen/HAS_PATIENT/drain plug,

preprocessed_text: while the oil is draining , wipe off the drain plug with a clean rag or towel .
remove the old drain plug gasket and replace it , making sure that the new gasket fit over the thread of the drain plug .
wipe down the area around the drain plug with a clean rag or towel .
reinstall the drain plug and tighten it a much a you can by hand .
use a 17 mm box end wrench to tighten the drain plug until it is snug .
do not over-tighten the drain plug . doing so may strip the thread or crack the oil pan . you can always come back later and tighten the drain plug more if needed .
tagged_relations: over-tighten/HAS_PATIENT/drain plug, tighten/HAS_PATIENT/drain plug,

preprocessed_text: move the oil drain pan so that it is directly under the oil filter .
remove the oil filter by turning it counterclockwise until it come free .
if the filter is on too tightly to remove by hand , use an oil filter wrench to loosen it first , then continue to remove it by hand .
tagged_relations: remove/HAS_AGENT/oil filter wrench, remove/HAS_PATIENT/filter, loosen/HAS_AGENT/oil filter wrench, loosen/HAS_PATIENT/filter, continue/HAS_PATIENT/filter,

preprocessed_text: place the oil filter with the open end facing down onto the oil drain pan to allow the old oil to drain out .
tagged_relations: place/HAS_AGENT/oil filter, place/HAS_PATIENT/oil drain pan, allow/HAS_AGENT/drain out,

preprocessed_text: dip a clean , gloved finger into a fresh bottle of oil and spread a thin layer of oil on the new oil filter 's gasket .
tagged_relations: dip/HAS_AGENT/gloved finger, spread/HAS_AGENT/gloved finger,

preprocessed_text: wipe off the oil filter thread and contact area on the engine with a clean rag or towel .
tagged_relations: wipe off/HAS_PATIENT/oil filter thread,

preprocessed_text: place the new oil filter over the thread and turn it clockwise until it is snug .
tagged_relations: place/HAS_PATIENT/new oil filter, turn/HAS_AGENT/new oil filter,

preprocessed_text: twist the oil filler cap counterclockwise and remove it from the valve cover .
tagged_relations: twist/HAS_AGENT/oil filler cap, twist/HAS_PATIENT/valve cover, remove/HAS_AGENT/oil filler cap, remove/HAS_PATIENT/valve cover,

preprocessed_text: place a funnel in the oil filler hole .
hold the funnel with one hand to steady it and pour 5.1 quart of 15 w-40 oil into the funnel .
tagged_relations: hold/HAS_PATIENT/funnel, pour/HAS_AGENT/funnel,

preprocessed_text: reinstall the oil filler cap and turn it clockwise until it is snug .
tagged_relations: reinstall/HAS_PATIENT/oil filler cap, turn/HAS_PATIENT/oil filler cap,

preprocessed_text: remove the dipstick , wipe it off with a clean rag or towel , reinsert it , and remove it again .
tagged_relations: remove/HAS_PATIENT/dipstick, wipe/HAS_PATIENT/dipstick, reinsert/HAS_PATIENT/dipstick, remove/HAS_PATIENT/dipstick,

preprocessed_text: reinsert the dipstick and add or remove any oil , if necessary .
place the engine panel back in it original location , making sure the two retaining tab go through their respective slot in the panel .
tagged_relations: place/HAS_PATIENT/engine panel, go through/HAS_AGENT/retaining tab, go through/HAS_PATIENT/panel,

preprocessed_text: secure the engine panel by pulling the retaining tab straight out , turning them 90 , and laying them down flat .
tagged_relations: secure/HAS_PATIENT/engine panel, pulling/HAS_AGENT/retaining tab, turning/HAS_AGENT/retaining tab,

preprocessed_text: hold the hood up with one hand and use the other hand to return the hood prop to it original location
tagged_relations: hold/HAS_PATIENT/hood, hold/HAS_AGENT/hand, use/HAS_AGENT/hand, return/HAS_AGENT/hood prop, return/HAS_PATIENT/hood prop,

preprocessed_text: close the hood firmly and make sure that the hood latch engages .
tagged_relations: close/HAS_PATIENT/hood, close/HAS_AGENT/hood latch,

preprocessed_text: open the rear part of the middle console .
grip the right side of the console and pull up towards the passenger seat to remove it .
locate the two bolt under the air conditioning control at the bottom of the face plate .
tagged_relations: locate/HAS_PATIENT/bolt, locate/HAS_PATIENT/air conditioning control,

preprocessed_text: loosen these two bolt with a basic socket wrench suited for 7 mm bolt .
tagged_relations: loosen/HAS_AGENT/basic socket wrench, loosen/HAS_PATIENT/bolt, loosen/HAS_PATIENT/bolt, basic socket wrench/HAS_PATIENT/7 mm,

preprocessed_text: wedge a spudger or plastic opening tool ( in place of the screwdriver shown ) under the top of the face plate .
tagged_relations: wedge/HAS_AGENT/spudger, wedge/HAS_AGENT/plastic opening tool,

preprocessed_text: apply pressure until the corner pop out of place .
tagged_relations: apply pressure/HAS_PATIENT/corner,

preprocessed_text: inspect the interior of the center console for damaged wire or other faulty component .
remove 4 , 7.9 mm nut using a 7.9 mm socket driver head
one of the nut is placed underneath the l-bracket . remove the l-bracket and the 3 circled nut before attempting to remove the remaining nut
tagged_relations: remove/HAS_PATIENT/l-bracket, remove/HAS_PATIENT/circled nut, attempting to remove/HAS_PATIENT/remaining nut,

preprocessed_text: pull cover off the body of the alternator
tagged_relations: pull/HAS_PATIENT/cover,

preprocessed_text: with the alternator cover removed , use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the two , 6 mm screw that hold the brush cover in place .
tagged_relations: remove/HAS_AGENT/2 phillips screwdriver, remove/HAS_PATIENT/6 mm screw, remove/HAS_PATIENT/brush cover,

preprocessed_text: remove the brush cover assembly from the alternator . you might need to insert a needle in the small hole to separate the brush from the rotor . pull it out without using much force to avoid damage .
avoid disconnecting wire unless otherwise specified !
use a 2 phillips screwdriver to remove the two 6 mm screw holding down the voltage regulator
locate and unscrew the 3 , 6 mm screw holding the bridge assembly in place
locate the copper lead connecting the stator to the bridge assembly . there are 3 set of 2 lead on the perimeter of the bridge , making 6 lead total .
these lead must be cut in order to remove the bridge from the alternator . these lead will have to be soldered back together on reassembly . keep the cut a clean a possible .
use wire cutter to cut all 6 of the lead on the perimeter of the bridge .
tagged_relations: cut/HAS_AGENT/wire cutter, cut/HAS_PATIENT/lead,

preprocessed_text: if necessary , use a pry bar to gently raise the top of the bridge assembly off the alternator
tagged_relations: raise/HAS_AGENT/pry bar, raise/HAS_PATIENT/top of the bridge assembly, raise/HAS_PATIENT/alternator,

preprocessed_text: be extremely careful with the pry bar . excessive force will damage the bridge assembly .
make sure the cut end of the copper lead are straight to make bridge assembly easier to pull off .
tagged_relations: make/HAS_AGENT/cut end, make/HAS_PATIENT/copper lead, pull off/HAS_AGENT/bridge assembly,

preprocessed_text: remove the lower section of the bridge assembly
use of a pry bar may be necessary . be gentle .
use a phillips 2 screwdriver or a 7.5 mm socket driver to unscrew the 4 , 7.5 mm bolt running along the outer perimeter of the alternator
tagged_relations: unscrew/HAS_AGENT/phillips 2 screwdriver, unscrew/HAS_AGENT/7.5 mm socket driver, unscrew/HAS_PATIENT/7.5 mm bolt,

preprocessed_text: use a c-clamp or another fixture to hold the pulley in place
be gentle with the clamp . excessive force will bend the pulley out of shape
use a ratchet with a 25 mm socket to remove the 25 mm hex nut from the pulley
once the nut is off , you can then remove the pulley .
once the pulley is removed , separate the rotor and stator . the stator is the piece with copper winding .
you can pull the stator out of the remaining cover and examine it .
tagged_relations: pull/HAS_AGENT/stator, examine/HAS_PATIENT/stator,

preprocessed_text: if the stator is scratched or damaged , you will need to replace it . look for scoring mark or cut piece of winding .
